{"step_by_step_thinking": "VLDL, or Very Low-Density Lipoprotein, is a type of lipoprotein that is involved in the transportation of fats and cholesterol within the body. According to Document [1], VLDL is made by the liver. Document [9] also supports this, stating that nascent VLDL particles are released into the bloodstream by the liver. There is no mention in the documents of VLDL being synthesized in the GIT (Gastrointestinal Tract). Therefore, the liver is the site of VLDL synthesis.", "answer_choice": "B"}
